constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 95 (Tuesday, June 1, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. ROUZER:
H.R. 3678.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 1
The Congress shall have the Power to lay and collect Taxes,
Duties, Imposts and Excises, to pay the Debt and provide for
the common Defense and general Welfare of the United States;
but all Duties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniform
throughout the United States.
[Page H2686]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Nutrition, Oversight, and Department Operations.

title: Drug Testing for Welfare Recipients Act
